nav.div: Banta Elementary School District » Parents » Disclosure of Student Records/Data

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman,serif; color: rgb(0, 33, 99);
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman,serif; color: rgb(0, 33, 99);

p.span: Disclosure of Student Record district letter.pdf

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman,serif; color: rgb(0, 33, 99);

p.span: ONFIDENTIAL STUDENT DATA: A recent lawsuit against the California Department of Education (CDE) is impacting all school districts across the state. In April 2012, two organizations, the Morgan Hill Concerned Parents Association and the Concerned Parent Association, filed a lawsuit against the CDE alleging widespread, systemic non-compliance by local education agencies with special education laws.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman,serif; color: rgb(0, 33, 99);
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman,serif; color: rgb(0, 33, 99);

p.span: The CDE denies these allegations and is actively defending the litigation. Banta Elementary School district was not a part of this lawsuit. Nonetheless, as a part of this lawsuit, CDE has been ordered by the court to release all data it has collected on general and special education students since Jan. 1, 2008.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman,serif; color: rgb(0, 33, 99);

p.span: For more information regarding the release of this data and how you can file an objection with the court to consider not releasing your data, visit:

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman,serif; color: rgb(0, 33, 99);

span.a: Disclosure of Student Record district letter.pdf
span.br: Disclosure of Student Record district letter - Spanish.pdf​
